greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Composite and every divisor (except 1) contains the digit 2.
comment: If k is in the sequence, then all composite divisors of k are in the sequence. - _Robert Israel_, Jul 11 2019
link: Robert Israel, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
example: 254 has divisors 1, 2, 127 and 254, all of which except 1 contain the digit 2.
maple: if isprime(n) then return false fi;
con2:= proc(n) option remember; member(2,convert(n,base,10)) end proc:
mathematica: fQ[n_, dgt_] := Union[ MemberQ[#, dgt] & /@ IntegerDigits@ Rest@ Divisors@ n][[1]]; Select[ Range[2, 4230], !PrimeQ[#] && fQ[#, 2] &] (* _Robert G. Wilson v_, Jun 11 2014 *)
program: (MAGMA) [m:m in [2..4300] | not IsPrime(m) and #[d:d in Divisors(m)|2 in Intseq(d)] eq #Divisors(m)-1]; // _Marius A. Burtea_, Jul 11 2019
results.author: _Erich Friedman_, Jul 04 2001
